intro: Doryphora sassafras, commonly known as the sassafras tree, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are elliptical with a waxy texture, and the flowers are usually white or cream in color. Doryphora sassafras is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests.
